comment.author: 41909278@N08
comment._content:
Four examples of AT-6A-NT, flying from an as yet unidentified field. Typically, these aircraft would carry a letter and three numbers on the fuselage, not just three numbers. The closest two aircraft, 41-16063 and 41-16156 are from the same construction batch. Similarly, the next two, 41-726 and 41-730 are sister ships, but from a much earlier batch. The cowls appear to be red.

Doug MacPhail
